text: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

text: Culture makes people understand each other better.
author: Chinua Achebe

text: Culture is the name for what people are interested in.
author: Susan Sontag

text: Culture is the widening of the mind and of the spirit.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Culture is the sum of all the forms of art, of love, and of thought.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The beauty of the world lies in the diversity of its cultures.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is the arts of collective intelligence.
author: Marshall McLuhan

text: Culture is a way of coping with the world by defining it in detail.
author: Malcolm Bradbury

text: Culture is the habit of being pleased with the best and knowing why.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: Culture is the social behavior and norms found in human societies.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is the process by which a person becomes all that they were created capable of being.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Culture is a way of life. It includes the customs, beliefs, values, art, and music of a particular group or society.
author: Anonymous

text: A culture is only as great as its dreams, and its dreams are dreamed by artists.
author: L. P. Hartley

text: Culture is a matrix of infinite possibilities and choices.
author: Hans-Georg Gadamer

text: Culture is the expression of our nature in our modes of living, and so it varies infinitely.
author: J. H. Plumb

text: Culture is the widening of the mind and of the spirit.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Culture is the intersection of people and life itself.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is the name for what people are interested in, their thoughts, their models, the books they read and the speeches they hear.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: Culture is the name for every pattern, every idea, and every product of a society that has been given value and meaning.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Culture is the glue that binds us together.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is what we make of the world.
author: Joost Meerloo

text: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

text: Culture is the arts made manifest in our lives.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is the sum of all the forms of art, of love, and of thought.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Culture is the sum total of human expression.
author: Raymond Williams

text: Culture is the way of life of a people, and it is reflected in their daily activities, their customs, their beliefs, and their art.
author: Anonymous

text: Culture is what we live for. It is the story we tell ourselves about ourselves.
author: Clifford Geertz

text: Culture is the means by which we gain control of our world.
author: Sidney Jourard

text: Culture is the process by which a person becomes all that they were created capable of being.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Culture is the shared values, beliefs, customs, behaviors, and artifacts that characterize a group or organization.
author: Edgar Schein

text: Culture is the way we learn to live together in a complex and changing world.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

text: Culture makes people understand each other better.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Culture is the widening of the mind and of the spirit.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Culture is a way of coping with the world by defining it.
author: Malcolm Bradbury

text: Culture is the name for what people are interested in.
author: Susan Sontag

text: A nation's culture resides in the hearts and in the soul of its people.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Culture is not just arts and letters, but also the way we live, our fundamental beliefs and values.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Culture is a way of life. It's not just about what we see or hear, it's about what we believe in and how we behave.
author: Queen Rania of Jordan

text: Culture is the sum total of all the things that a person learns, including beliefs, values, knowledge, skills, and attitudes.
author: Charles W. L. Hill

text: Culture is a way of life shared by a group of people, including beliefs, values, customs, behaviors, and artifacts that they have in common.
author: Richard L. Daft

text: Culture is a powerful tool for building bridges between people of different backgrounds.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: Culture is a way of understanding and appreciating the differences that exist between people, and recognizing the similarities that connect us all.
author: Azar Nafisi

text: Culture is the social heritage of a group of people, passed on from generation to generation.
author: Saul Bellow

text: Culture is not just a set of practices and beliefs, it's the foundation of our identity as a people.
author: Barack Obama

text: Culture is the glue that holds a society together.
author: Paul E. Farmer

text: Culture is the way in which people behave, think, and feel.
author: Margaret Mead
